commands.name: az network-function traffic-collector create
commands.summary: Create an Azure Traffic Collector resource.
commands.syntax:
az network-function traffic-collector create --name
                                             --resource-group
                                             [--location]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--tags]
examples: az network-function traffic-collector create --resource-group rg1 --traffic-collector-name atc1 --location eastus

commands.name: az network-function traffic-collector delete
commands.summary: Delete a specified Azure Traffic Collector resource.
commands.syntax:
az network-function traffic-collector delete [--ids]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--yes]
examples: az network-function traffic-collector delete --resource-group rg1 --traffic-collector-name atc1

commands.name: az network-function traffic-collector list
commands.summary: Return a list of Azure Traffic Collectors.

commands.name: az network-function traffic-collector show
commands.summary: Get the specified Azure Traffic Collector resource.
examples: az network-function traffic-collector show --resource-group rg1 --traffic-collector-name atc1

commands.name: az network-function traffic-collector update
commands.summary: Update an Azure Traffic Collector resource.
commands.syntax:
az network-function traffic-collector update [--add]
                                             [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--location]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--remove]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--set]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--tags]
examples: az network-function traffic-collector update --resource-group rg1 --traffic-collector-name atc1 --tags key=value

commands.name: az network-function traffic-collector wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
